content.1: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour:
content.3: Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth
content.4: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.
content.6: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.
content.7: I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon the earth.
content.8: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.
content.9: Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith;
content.10: If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom
content.11: Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.
content.12: The words of a wise man’s mouth
content.13: The beginning of the words of his mouth
content.14: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?
content.15: The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.
content.16: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king
content.18: By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.
content.19: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all
content.20: Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
